generalInfo:
This trip takes you to the mystical south of Peru - a fascinating country with a great variety of landscapes and ecosystems, and a rich heritage of pre-colombian culture hidden in the mountains or deserted plains.

The south of Peru is an area in Latin America with a different energy & vibration. The Andes & Indian people show and teach us something that is very worthwhile to experience. The people, the spiritual heritage of their ancestors, and the places you visit, will make this a special journey.

You will visit the high sanddunes of Ica with amazing views over the area and stay in a desert oasis, at nearby NP Paracas you will see the large colonies of birds and sealions in Islas Ballestas. You visit the mysterious geometrical figures and lines of Nazca and explore one of the deepest canyons of the world, the Colca canyon, for several days. This trip takes you to Lake Titicaca and the inspiring city of Cusco, from where we offer several possibilities for trekking or daywalks. You can choose among others between the Inca trail, Lares and Salkantay trekkings or other trails, and/or opt for a rainforest extension in the National Park of Manu or Tambopata Reserve near Puerto Maldonado. At the end of the trip you can have either free days in Cusco extra, to immerse yourself in citylife, go for shopping, or see more of the Sacred Valley, eg have a mountain bike excursion to Chincheros, Maras & Moray, visit the Inca temples of Pisaq & Qenko, visit a social children project in or around Cusco, or fly back directly from Puerto Maldonado after a rainforest extension to Lima.

Besides individual tailor made tours we offer also our Tourguide services to small organised groups, the itinery may include all elements your group is looking for, daywalks, cultural excursions, visits to archaeological sites, the Inca trail, other trails, rainforest extensions etc. You will be accompanied by an expert on Andean nature & culture. We invite you to have a direct Skype conference with your Tourguide and ask all the questions you have ! Your Tourmanager is internationally certified, every year trained in first aid, has guided 140 grouptrips, is educated as a westerner in an Indian lineage, one of the most knowledgeable guides in Latin America and last but not least very good company.

Example itinerary - Roundtrip South Peru. Note that with the Inca trail included the trip becomes 20 days instead of 18 days and you still have 2 free days in Cusco at end for optional excursions or free time. All transfers & bus tickets will be arranged in advance for you by our agent in Lima and reservations for the Inca trail have to be confirmed 4-5 months ahead in high season. The accommodation is 3-4 star Peruvian hotels, all selected for a spectacular view or a specific setting & ambience. If you wish to stay for a few days in more luxurious hotels, eg in Cusco, we can adapt that to your wishes. The itinerary below can be modified to your personal wishes including departure date, duration, accommodation used & how long you spend in each destination.

The Inca Trail, permits & alternatives: the classical 4 day Inca Trail to Machu Picchu is one of the most famous treks in the world. The appeal of this particular trek is the stunning combination of Inca ruins, magnificent mountains, exotic vegetation and extraordinary ecological variety. The trail goes over high passes with unforgettable views, through cloud forest, and finally into subtropical vegetation. After the trail you can choose to return to Ollantaytambo on day 4 and stay overnight there, to continue to Cusco, or stay one night longer in Aguas Calientes and return on the 5th day - giving more time to explore Machu Picchu, the hot baths of Aquas Calientes, climb the mountain Putu Kusi and visit the waterfalls & botanical garden Mandor in the surrounding area. On contacting us we can check directly the Inca Trail permit availability for you. Note that the rain season may start in December, lasts until end of March and that the Inca trail is closed in the month February. In case the classical Inca trail is fully booked there are several alternative trails possible, as the 4 day Lares trail or the Salkantay Inca trail which leads you in 5 days to Aquas Calientes beneath Machu Picchu without the requirement of a permit. Besides there is a short Inca trail program of 2 days called the Camino Real which requires a permit same as the classical Inca trail.

More trekkings and trails we offer are the Ausangate trekking in 4 to 5 days, the Ausangate Sibinacocha trekking in 7 to 8 days, the classical Choquequirao trekking, the Juchujqosqo trek from 2-3 days from Tambomachay to Calca, Alpamayo, Cordillera Blanca & Cordillera Huayhuash treks and a few more new trails. The most challenging Inca trekking we can offer is from Cachora to Choquequirao and from there continue via Yanama to the Inca site Vitcos (Yurak Rumi, described as White Rock by Hiram Bingham) in the Vilcabamba valley from where you continue through the mountains and rainforest to Santa Theresa and Machu Picchu.

Extra daywalks in the Colca canyon: in case you wish to make extra daywaks on your own in the Colca canyon we supply the GPS data of three possible daywalks of different level as part of a tailor made booking. In case you wish to walk with a private guide you can make a short trekking of eg 3-4 days from Cruz del Condor to the bottom of the canyon, stay in a lovely green oasis with swimming pool on the third day and return to Cabanaconde the last day. There is also a trekking possible from Colca canyon to Cusco, just for those that have time enough and like to be fully off the beaten path with an extra challenge.

Rainforest extensions: Rainforest extensions can be arranged to Manu National Park (5-9 days) or to Tambopata National Reserve (3-5 days of which one day can be at camp), both including visits to macaw clay licks.

Approximately half the area of Switzerland, the Manu Biosphere is a complete ecosystem with protected watershed embracing Andean montane cloud forest, tropical lowland forest and the Alto Madre de Dios and Manu river drainage systems. Wildlife abundance aside, the journey into the park itself is amazingly spectacular and not to be missed. The two day trip from Cusco takes you over the Andes to an elevation of 4000m, past pre-inca ruins, down through the cloud forest and finally into lush, lowland rainforest.

The Tambopata National Reserve in situated in the province of Madre-de-Dios and is more easily accesible then Manu NP. Within walking distance of the lodge lies a tranquil oxbow lake formerly part of the river Tambopata. The undisturbed and thriving ecosystem here means that the lake can support a family of giant river otters along with other endangered species such as black caimans. Bird life is also prolific; with a record breaking 620 species being recorded in the area surrounding the lodge, you will not cease to be amazed by the variety and colors.

Family holidays: This tour can be tailormade to suit the needs of a family, taking in to account the ages of any children. For example, we could reduce the travelling, and stay longer in individual destinations such as Cusco & Lake Titicaca. Children will love the experience to be in the Peruvian rainforest, which can be added to the travel, leaving from Cusco. For families with kids (or any travelparty) we can turn around this sample itinery and start with Cusco to have a better adaptation to altitude, from there to Titicaca lake and continue with a private guided program into Colca canyon, stay in Cabanaconde, Granja del Colca and pass the highest pass Mirador de los Volcanes at a stage that everyone is well adapted. This has been proven to work out well for families, ask for more information.

The Inca jungle Trail from Cusco to Machu Picchu is a new route which involves biking from Abra Malaga to Santa Marta, walking on 2 newly discovered Inca trails and the highest zipline of South America. The multiple terrain trip, includes recently discovered real Inca paths, archaeological ruins, an 60 km bike downhill on mountain bikes, through the mountains from Abra Malaga to the green valleys below and the jungle base of Santa Maria. On the third day you reach the top of Llactapata with amazing views, flanked by the high peak of the Salkantay. The fourth day, after three nights the trip ends with going up to Machu Picchu and enjoy the sunrise. You return to Cusco by train and bus.

Galapagos extension & Ecuador: For those who have the time and budget, your Peru roundtrip can be given a final touch with a spectacular Galapagos cruise of several days at the end. You have cruises of 4, 5, 7 and 8 days up to full itineries visiting all islands in 15 days. There is a wide range in boats with different comfort classes and style. We help you selecting the right boat on the right time within your budget with all connecting flights from Lima to Guayaguil or Quito to make this one in a lifetime experience come true. For a family booking we can give discounts on Galapagos excursions. A few extra days in Quito and surroundings can be added of course as well.

We have more than 200 independent reviews on Responsible Travel on our destinations in Latin America from Cuba, Bolivia, Brazil, Peru, Mexico, Colombia to Chile and Argentina. Contact us for a chat via Skype and ask for a tailor made itinery and quote.

Shortlist of most important festivals along the South Peru itinery:
February, Virgen de las Candelaria Festival, Puno
Feb-March, Verano Negro, Afro-Peruvian dancefestival, Alta Chincha
March, La Vendimia Wine Festival, second week of March in the region of Ica
May, Virgen de Chapi Festival, close to Arequipa
June, Inti Raymi Festival, 24th June with several days of folkloric celebrations before the 24th, Cusco
July, San Juan Festival, Taquile island Titicaca lake and many other places
November, All Saints Day (Día de Todos Santos) & All Souls Day (Día de los Muertos), Arequipa, rest of Peru
December, Andean Christmas

The Titicaca lake with Sun & Moon island you can also visit from Bolivia, see our Bolivia itineries.

dayInfo.description: When you arrive on the airport you will be picked up by your driver and brought to your hotel Ayenda El patio in Miraflores, in a nice zone of Lima from where you can make excursions to the old city centre. The whole program of your travel will be talked over with you personally this day at your hotel. Upgrades hotels on whole itinery possible. Note that we can turn the itinery around and start with Cusco, then to Titicaca and from there to Colca canyon.

Transfer Lima-Paracas in the morning by public bus. Excursion Paracas desert in afternoon. Hotel Paracas Sunset. All taxi transfers to/from bus stations are private and included. Alternative: bus and taxi transfer to desert oasis Huacachinero. In the midday included a tour in the high sanddunes with great views, overnight at desert oasis hotel or even in the sand dunes.

Excursion by boat to Ballestas Islands to view the large populations of seabirds and sealions in the morning. After excursion transfer from Paracas to Nazca by public bus, hotel Oro Viejo / Don Agucho.
Flight over Nazca lines included in morning. Buggy cultural tour to Cachuachi & Usaca with sand boarding at high sand dunes included in afternoon. By luxury nightbus in VIP class to Arequipa.

Free days to visit the colonial city Arequipa and prepare yourself for the 3-day program in the Colca Canyon. You stay in a boutique hotel in the colonial center Casa de Avila. All taxi transfers to/from bus station are private and included.

Transfer from Arequipa to Chivay with private bus. You will have spectacular views and cross a pass of 4800 m altitude. You stay in hotel Mamayacchi, in teh authentic village of Coporaque in the middle of the Colca valley. In late afternoon is possible to visit the thermal baths of Chivay as part of the tour.

Day Colca canyon with visit to Cruz del Condor in early morning. You can see condors ascending on the wind. With a little bit luck, you can see the condors flying over on a few metres distance. When the Condors have reached great altitudes, you are leaving to Chivay by private bus again. In the midday extra free time in Chivay to visit the local market and-or make a spectacular half daywalk through the canyon landscape & pittoresque Indian villages along the Colca canyon to further acclimatize to the altitude of about 3500 m. This hike would be on your own and we will give you the GPS data. Accommodation in hotel Pozo del Cielo in Chivay . Alternative: go with a private mountain and cultural guide to the Colca canyon in a minivan and have several private guided hikes in the Colca canyon. There are 4 beautiful all very different hikes to make of which 3 are full day programs.

By tourist bus from Chivay to Puno, along the beautiful landscapes of the Altiplano, boutique 4 star hotel Casona Plaza, historical center Puno. Note that with the actual political situation of 2023 travel via Puno is not recommended or even not possible, so you will return from Chivay to Arequipa and fly to Cusco or travel by bus from Chivay to Cusco.

Lake Titicaca 2 day excursion. You start with a small transfer to the harbour from where you visit by local boat the floating islands of Uros. From here you take off to the island Amantani where you meet your host family for your overnight stay. For a spectacular sunset you can walk to the temples on the top of your island with your guide and celebrate in the evening folkloric dances in the community hall. The next day you are picked up by your boat again to visit Taquile, where you make a small walk over the island, buy some local handicrafts and then return to Puno, Casona Plaza hotel.

Transfer from Puno to Cusco with a cultural bus tour; an itinerary by bus with several interesting cultural stops along the way. Another option is to go by train. Accommodation in Cusco in the former Inka and colonial part of the city San Blas, hotel Amaru / Inkarri / Tikawasi with view or in the colonial lower part of the city at hotel Amerindias.

Free day in Cusco, the former capital of the Inca empire for cultural visits, shopping & novo andina cuisine. This day also give you the opportunity to prepare yourself for the classic Inca trail, Salkantay trail, or another trail in case you chose for these extra hiking options. Optional half or full day Cusco city tour. Optional Gastronomic tour Cusco: Visit the Central Market of San Pedro Tour by section, fruits, meats, potatoes, explanations about the great variety of supplies, different kinds of quinoa, corn and potatoes, exotic fruits and the inputs of Peruvian cuisine. Then each participant has the opportunity to prepare Pisco sour, starter plate, main course and dessert. (In addition, the institution finances projects for single mothers, and street children that were abandoned). Includes: Chef Guide, transportation, Pisco Sour, entrances, main dish and dessert. Guided Walking Tour Cusco half or full day. View of the historic center, San Blas, cathedral, stone of 12 angles, main square, Garcilaso House Museum, Recoleta Koricancha Street.

Machu Picchu program fully included. You travel to Aguas Calientes by private bus and train, where you may walk to the botanical garden or thermal waters, Wiracocha Inn / hotel Presidente. In the early morning on day 15, you go up to Machu Picchu to enjoy the sunrise over the ruins. You have a private guided tour in the morning included. You travel back by train and by bus from Ollantaytambo / Poroy to Cusco in the late afternoon, Accommodation in Cusco in the former Inka and colonial part of the city San Blas, hotel Amaru / Inkarri / Tikawasi with view. Optional: to add the Machu Picchu mountain trail to your program in the early morning and have the guided tour on the MP site after this trail.

Two free days in Cusco to immerse in city life, to walk and visit the Sacred valley, Inca ruins as Qenko, Tambomachay & Pisaq, local markets and villages in the surroundings of Cusco, or to prepare yourself for a visit to the Amazon rainforest as extension, NP Manu / Reserve Tambopata (from 3 - 9 days). Accommodation in Cusco in the former Inka and colonial part of the city San Blas, hotel Amaru / Inkarri / Tikawasi with view.

Transfer from hotel to airport, early domestic flight Cusco - Lima included with LATAM. Optional guided tour in Lima possible when the international flight departure falls in the evening. With the Inca trail included you may have 18, 19 or 20 days in this itinery depending on which day you start the Inca trail.
